column1: level0#L0#Level 0##Unprocessed instrument and payload data at full resolution. CCI does not make recommendations regarding formats or content for data at this processing level.
level1A#L1A#Level 1A##Reconstructed unprocessed instrument data at full resolution
column4: including radiometric and geometric calibration coefficients and georeferencing parameters

column1: level1B#L1B#Level 1B##Level 1A data that have been processed to sensor units.
level1C#L1C#Level 1C##Level 1b data that have been further processed
column2: eg by correcting radiances or by mapping onto a spatial grid
column3: prior to deriving geophysical variables from the data.

column1: level2#L2#Level 2##Retrieved environmental variables at the same resolution and location as the level 1 source
level2Preprocessed#L2P#Level 2 Pre-processing##Geophysical variables derived from Level 1 source data at the same resolution and location as the level 1 data
column2: typically in a satellite projection with geographic information. These data form the fundamental basis for higher level CCI products.

column1: level3#L3#Level 3##Level 2 variables mapped on a defined grid with reduced requirements for ancillary data. Three types of L3 products are defined:
level3U#L3U#Level 3U##Uncollated (L3U): L2 data granules remapped to a space grid without combining any observations from overlapping orbits.
level3C#L3C#Level 3C##Collated (L3C): Observations combined from a single instrument into a space-time grid.
level3S#L3S#Level 3S##Super-collated (L3S): observations combined from multiple instruments into a space-time grid.
level4#L4#Level 4##Data sets created from the analysis of lower level data that result in gridded
